description: To fell and treat 2 Oak trees T1 & T2 on TPO 724
decision_conditions: Two applications have been received from the same applicant and a note to read both applications as a dual submission. The applications seek the Council's permission to fell a total of three mature, protected Oaks. All are significant and prominent landscape features to those living in, and visiting, Long Lane, Uxbridge. Long Lane is also a main trunk road through the borough with a high volume of transient visitors. All three Oaks have a high amenity value, individually and as a group. They contribute to local biodiversity and assist with removing pollutants from the air. The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the trees is both present and future because they have the potential for long life expectancies.

Although assessing a tree's amenity value is subjective, the CAVAT system (Capital Asset Value for Amenity Trees) has been produced by the London Tree Officers Association (LTOA) to enable a monetary figure to be put on individual trees - to enable a basis for managing t
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
